awd_abstract_narration: Stonehill College requests support from NSF for connection of its               campus network to NSFNET.  NEARnet is the midlevel network                      located in the New England region that will provide operations                  and network information services.  It will give Stonehill College               a 56 thousand bits per second connection to the NSFNET, a high                  speed (1.5 - 45 million bits per second) National Backbone                      network.                                                                                                                                                        The College needs greater functionality and network speed to be                 able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file transfers               along with being able to implement a more reliable mail system.                 Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.  This                 is also a unique opportunity for the school to explore innovative               educational resources.***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
